Class DatabaseFiller

  • java.lang.Object
    • DatabaseFiller
  • public class DatabaseFiller
extends java.lang.Object
    Used to fill the Endgame Database with GameValues for all possible boards up to a specified size, in a systematic way to ensure that we have as quick an AI as possible at run-time.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      DatabaseFiller()

      void evaluateCombinations​(int n, int maxValue, int rows, int columns, int maxEmptySquares, long finishTime)
      Given a range of values (0 to maxValue), generates all possible combinations of a list of values of size n.
      void fillEndgameDatabase​(int maxSize, int runTime, int maxEmptySquares)
      Filling the endgame Database, generating all the combinations and evaluating them one by one, rather than finding a list of all possible boards.

    • Method Detail

      • getXCoordinate

        private int getXCoordinate​(int squareValue,
                           int noOfColumns)
        Returns the X co-ordinate for a given square value, based on the number of columns in the associated board
        Parameters:
        squareValue - value associated with the square
        noOfColumns - number of columns on the board
        Returns:
        integer indicating the x co-ordinate value

      • getYCoordinate

        private int getYCoordinate​(int squareValue,
                           int noOfColumns)
        Returns the Y co-ordinate for a given square value, based on the number of columns in the associated board
        Parameters:
        squareValue - value associated with the square
        noOfColumns - number of columns on the board
        Returns:
        integer indicating the y co-ordinate value

      • generateBoard

        public Board generateBoard​(int[] combination,
                           int rows,
                           int columns,
                           int maxEmptySquares)
        Generating a board object, given a list of integers which store information about the squares states. Returns null if we not a board that we want to evaluate e.g. over 2 pieces of 1 colour, only 1 square etc.
        Parameters:
        combination - list of integers indicating square states.
        Returns:
        Generated Board object, or null

      • combinationsHelper

        public void combinationsHelper​(int n,
                               int position,
                               int value,
                               int maxValue,
                               int[] combination,
                               int rows,
                               int columns,
                               int maxEmptySquares,
                               long finishTime)
        Helper method for generateCombinations(), recursively adding to the combination list. Once at base case, generates a board object using the list and if it's not already stored in the database, evaluates the board and adds the game value to the database.
        Parameters:
        n - size of the list
        position - index to add a number to the list
        value - integer value to add to the list, at given position
        maxValue - maximum value that an integer in the list can take
        combination - list to add the value to

      • evaluateCombinations

        public void evaluateCombinations​(int n,
                                 int maxValue,
                                 int rows,
                                 int columns,
                                 int maxEmptySquares,
                                 long finishTime)
        Given a range of values (0 to maxValue), generates all possible combinations of a list of values of size n.
        Parameters:
        n - size of the list of values
        maxValue - maximum value that an integer in the list can take

      • fillEndgameDatabase

        public void fillEndgameDatabase​(int maxSize,
                                int runTime,
                                int maxEmptySquares)
        Filling the endgame Database, generating all the combinations and evaluating them one by one, rather than finding a list of all possible boards.
        Parameters:
        maxSize - maximum board size
        runTime - number of minutes to evaluate for
        maxEmptySquares -
